you can choose dresses or gowns that emphasize your lower body, such as those with an A-line or flared skirt.
You can also opt for dresses that create a cinched waist or have a wrap-style design.
Additionally, you can try to avoid clothing that adds extra volume to your upper body, such as ruffles or puffy sleeves, as they can make you appear broader.
Instead, opt for more streamlined designs and add a pop of color or statement accessory to draw the attention downward.
